TextLibrary.Text: Emperor Selentius XVII
Good! You're back!
Good! You're back!
Good! You're back!
Good! You're back!
Yes, sir. As I said, the Queen is anxiously awaiting your answer.
Yes, sir. As I said, the Queen is anxiously awaiting your answer.
Yes, sir. As I said, the Queen is anxiously awaiting your answer.
Yes, sir. As I said, the Queen is anxiously awaiting your answer.
Is that so? Well... I do hate to keep a fellow monarch waiting.
Is that so? Well... I do hate to keep a fellow monarch waiting.
Is that so? Well... I do hate to keep a fellow monarch waiting.
Is that so? Well... I do hate to keep a fellow monarch waiting.
I'll return immediately with your reply.
I'll return immediately with your reply.
I'll return immediately with your reply.
I'll return immediately with your reply.

Well, it's not... quite... done just yet. I am... composing it. It will take some time. Correspondance with royalty cannot be rushed, can it now? But, while you are waiting, I have a task for you. You have heard of the Minotaur Slavers to the south? I want you to pay them a visit and ask them to move on.

You have heard of the Minotaur Slavers to the south? I want you to pay them a visit and ask them to move on.

You have heard of the Minotaur Slavers to the south? I want you to pay them a visit and ask them to move on.

Well, it's not... quite... done just yet. I am... composing it. It will take some time. Correspondance with royalty cannot be rushed, can it now? But, while you are waiting, I have a task for you. You have heard of the Minotaur Slavers to the south? I want you to pay them a visit and ask them to move on.
Your Majesty...you have a rather large army at your command. Wouldn't they be able to do this more effectively than me?
Your Majesty...you have a rather large army at your command. Wouldn't they be able to do this more effectively than me?
Your Majesty...you have a rather large army at your command. Wouldn't they be able to do this more effectively than me?
Your Majesty...you have a rather large army at your command. Wouldn't they be able to do this more effectively than me?
Yes, yes...I could send my troops. But if I show them an Agarian Knight, that will leave them wondering, eh?
Yes, yes...I could send my troops. But if I show them an Agarian Knight, that will leave them wondering, eh?
Yes, yes...I could send my troops. But if I show them an Agarian Knight, that will leave them wondering, eh?
Yes, yes...I could send my troops. But if I show them an Agarian Knight, that will leave them wondering, eh?
Leave them wondering what, exactly?
Leave them wondering what, exactly?
Leave them wondering what, exactly?
Leave them wondering what, exactly?

Well... they will wonder if we are allied with Agaria for one thing. But...you see, the real problem is that the local guardsman and troops have been known to accept... compensation... from the Slavers to look the other way. Something tells me that you would be above such material temptations.

Well... they will wonder if we are allied with Agaria for one thing. But...you see, the real problem is that the local guardsman and troops have been known to accept... compensation... from the Slavers to look the other way. Something tells me that you would be above such material temptations.
No Knight would accept money to turn a blind eye to slavery.
No Knight would accept money to turn a blind eye to slavery.
No Knight would accept money to turn a blind eye to slavery.
No Knight would accept money to turn a blind eye to slavery.
Exactly! And if they think that Agarian Knights might be patrolling our shores, then they will think twice about landing here in the future.
Exactly! And if they think that Agarian Knights might be patrolling our shores, then they will think twice about landing here in the future.
